metadata.title: How to Add YouTube Cards 2025: Complete Guide
metadata.description: Add YouTube cards to your videos. Timing, types, and best practices for engagement.

hero.headline: How to Add YouTube Cards
hero.subheadline: Interactive elements that keep viewers on your channel. Strategic placement matters.

sections.content: YouTube cards are interactive elements that appear during videos—linking to other videos, playlists, channels, or polls. Well-placed cards extend watch sessions and guide viewers to related content. Here's how to use them effectively.

content.title: Video/Playlist Cards
content.description: Link to specific videos or playlists. Most common type.

content.title: Channel Cards
content.description: Promote other channels. Collabs or recommendations.

content.title: When Mentioning
content.description: Card appears when you reference related content. 'Speaking of...'

content.title: Before Drop-Off
content.description: Place before common exit points. Analytics shows where.

content.title: Relevant Moments
content.description: When topic of linked video comes up naturally.

sections.title: Card Checklist
content: Video has relevant content to link?

faq.question: How many cards per video?
faq.answer: YouTube allows up to 5 cards. But use only what's needed. 2-3 well-placed cards often outperform 5 random ones.

faq.question: Best timing for cards?
faq.answer: When you mention related content verbally. Also before natural drop-off points. Don't cluster at the end.

faq.question: Cards vs end screens?
faq.answer: Different purposes. Cards work throughout video for contextual links. End screens are for final CTA. Use both.

faq.question: Do cards hurt retention?
faq.answer: Potentially—if they send viewers away. But keeping viewers on your channel overall is the goal. Strategic placement minimizes loss.
